business.headline: Retail inflation eases to 8-year low of 1.55% in JulyRetail inflation declined to an 8-year low in July 2025 as food prices plunged sharply. Both rural and urban areas experienced deflation in food prices, with rural food inflation at -1.74% and urban at -1.90%.
Sensex ends 368 points lower, Nifty below 24,500; Maruti down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 368.49 points to end at 80,235.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 97.65 points to close at 24,487.40.
RBI's job gets tougher, thanks to 50% US tariffsRBI kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% and warned that US tariffs and global supply issues could quickly change the outlook.

SIPs for the win: How Trump tariffs shook D-Street but boosted mutual fundsMutual funds are seeing record inflows even as markets struggle. Are SIP investors spotting an opportunity the rest are missing, or is it just faith in long-term discipline?
India bans land imports of more Bangladesh jute productsEarlier on June 27, India prohibited imports of a number of jute products and woven fabrics from Bangladesh through all land routes.

5 SIP myths that hurt investors more than markets, explains stock market expertMany investors blame market volatility for poor returns, but often, it's the myths they believe about SIPs that do more harm. Here's what an expert reveals.

How to repay a Rs 1 crore home loan in under 10 years and save Rs 52 lakhThe joy of getting the keys to your home is unmatched, but the reality of a 20-year (or longer) home loan often brings with it a heavy financial commitment.

Trump tariffs could worsen India's affordable housing crisis. Here's howDonald Trump's steep tariffs on Indian exports risk inflating construction costs, squeezing developers, and pushing affordable housing further out of reach for millions already struggling in India's overheated property market

New and old income tax regimes explained as ITR filing deadline extendedFor FY 2024-25, the new tax regime is automatically applied to taxpayers. Salaried individuals can still choose the old regime while filing their return, but if you miss the due date and file a belated ITR, it can only be done under the new regime.

Field notes from building a billion-dollar luxury brandDiverse leadership isn't just good business, it's the future blueprint for luxury real estate success. Parisa Seif, Managing Partner at Kleindienst Group, writes

New Income Tax Bill 2025: Will changes in the revised bill impact taxpayers?The updated Bill, presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on August 11, incorporates most of the recommendations made by the Select Committee. It is set to replace the six-decade-old Income Tax Act, 1961.

Sensex, Nifty rebound after falling in early trade; inflation data in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex fell over 150 points at the opening bell but swiftly recovered by 9:23 am. The Sensex was trading 10 points higher at 80,614.05, while the NSE Nifty50 traded 12.80 points higher at 24,597.85.

entertainment.headline: Saiyaara OTT release: When and where to watch Ahaan Panday-Aneet Padda filmSaiyaara, which is currently running in theatres, will premiere on OTT in a month's time. The Mohir Suri directorial, starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, released in theatres on July 18.

39 years after Baghwaan Dada, Hrithik and Rajinikanth to clash at box officeWith Hrithik Roshan's 'War 2' and Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' clashing at the box office, fans recalled the time when Roshan shared screen space with the veteran actor in 'Bhagwaan Dada (1986).

Coolie cast fee: What Rajinikanth, Aamir Khan and Lokesh Kanagaraj earnedAs advance bookings for 'Coolie' soar worldwide, here's a peek at what the members of the film, including director Lokesh Kanagaraj and Superstar Rajinikanth, earned for their contribution to the film.

Kartik Aaryan to play Air Force pilot in Shimit Amin's film Captain India: ReportActor Kartik Aaryan is reportedly set to collaborate with 'Chak De India' director Shimit Amin. He will play the role of an Air Force pilot in the film titled 'Captain India'. Filming will begin in 2026 with locations in India and Morocco.

Channing Tatum joins Demon Slayer Infinity Castle English voice cast Hollywood actor Channing Tatum and voice actor Rebecca Wang join the English dub cast of 'Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – The Movie: Infinity Castle', the next chapter in the record-breaking anime saga. The film premieres in Japan in July 2025.

When Kamal Haasan said no to Main Hoon Na with a polite 'duck off' to Farah KhanFilmmaker Farah Khan shared that Kamal Haasan refused a role in her debut film 'Main Hoon Na'. She recalled travelling to Chennai to narrate the script. The role eventually went to actor Suniel Shetty.

A Gen-Z review of Sholay: 50 years later, still a total vibeRevisiting Bollywood classic Sholay through a Gen-Z lens: Basanti's feminist flair, Jai-Veeru's ultimate friendship goals, Gabbar's meme-worthy villainy, and Thakur's poetic revenge.

The Recruit's Noah Centineo to play young John Rambo in prequel: ReportActor Noah Centineo is set to feature in the upcoming 'John Rambo' origin film directed by Jalmari Helander. The project aims to reboot the iconic franchise with a fresh take on Rambo's early years during the Vietnam War.

Rupali Ganguly reacts to top court order: Care for stray dogs, don't exile themRupali Ganguly has urged compassion as the Supreme Court mandates the relocation of stray dogs in Delhi and the NCR to address rising incidents of dog bites and rabies.

Param Sundari trailer: Fun, romance and Rajinikanth in Janhvi-Sidharth's love storyThe much-awaited trailer for 'Param Sundari' featuring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor has released. Directed by Dinesh Vijan, 'Param Sundari' will release in theatres on August 29.

Dogs are Delhiites: John Abraham to Chief Justice over court's order on straysActor John Abraham wrote a letter to Chief Justice BR Gavai, urging the court to review its order on stray dogs in Delhi. The actor also cited the World Health Organisation in his letter.

Rajinikanth called out for body-shaming Coolie co-stars Soubin Shahir, Aamir KhanSuperstar Rajinikanth delivered a 41-minute speech at the 'Coolie' audio launch. However, he was criticised for calling Aamir Khan 'short' and Soubin Shahir 'bald'.

Bollywood slams top court's order to move dogs to sheltersBollywood stars have opposed the Supreme Court's order against stray dogs. Actors like Janhvi Kapoor and Varun Dhawan say, "Just no compassion left."

KBC 17: Officers Sofiya Qureshi, Vyomika Singh recount Operation Sindoor with Big BActor Amitabh Bachchan welcomed Col Sofiya Qureshi, Wing Commander Vyomika Singh and Commander Prerna Deosthalee in 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. The upcoming episode has been shot as an Independence Day special.

Hip-hop duo Seedhe Maut approached for Bigg Boss 19: SourceThe makers of the much-awaited reality show 'Bigg Boss 19' have reportedly approached hip-hop duo Seedhe Maut. Having delivered songs like 'Raat Ki Rani' and 'Khatta Flow', Siddhant Sharma and Abhijay Negi have a massive fan following amongst Gen Z.

Not just Indian companies, Singapore firm announces holiday for Rajinikanth's CoolieTwo Singapore companies offered paid holidays for Tamil workers to watch Rajinikanth's 'Coolie'. Many Indian companies announced holidays on August 14 as well.

Coolie piracy blocked by Madras High Court, new order passed for Rajinikanth's filmMadras High Court intervenes to curb piracy of Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', ahead of its release, blocking ISPs and cable networks from streaming pirated versions. The court highlights that the producers will have to suffer an 'irreparable injury' if piracy persists.

Coolie advance sales skyrocket in US, Rajinikanth craze explodes in India'Coolie' has now achieved an unprecedented feat at the box office. The Rajinikanth starrer has registered a huge presence at the ticket window in the US, setting new records for Tamil cinema.

Nidhhi Agerwal denies role in using Andhra Pradesh government car for eventActor Nidhhi Agerwal clarified her non-involvement in using the Andhra Pradesh government car for an event. She explained that she had no role in it.

general news.headline: Poll panel correct, Aadhaar can't be accepted as citizenship proof: Top courtThe Supreme Court backed the Election Commission's stand that Aadhaar is not proof of citizenship, as petitioners challenged Bihar's voter roll revision, citing mass exclusions.

Retail inflation eases to 8-year low of 1.55% in JulyRetail inflation declined to an 8-year low in July 2025 as food prices plunged sharply. Both rural and urban areas experienced deflation in food prices, with rural food inflation at -1.74% and urban at -1.90%.

No action against owners of Delhi's old vehicles until next hearing: Supreme CourtA Supreme Court bench on Tuesday ordered that no coercive steps be taken against owners of diesel vehicles over 10 years old and petrol vehicles over 15 years old in Delhi-NCR, until further orders.

Cruel, shortsighted: Rahul Gandhi slams Supreme Court's order on stray dogsRahul Gandhi on Tuesday joined a chorus of voices opposing the Supreme Court's order to round up and permanently relocate all stray dogs in Delhi-NCR, calling blanket removals "cruel, shortsighted".

Heera Mandi 2.0: From flings to fights, Pak's transactional ties with the USIn a world of diplomatic flirtations, Washington and Islamabad star in a transactional situationship. Their unstable love-hate saga teeters on mistrust, power plays, and fleeting alliances. We revisit this rom-com with a series of scandalous stories.

Cash row: Lok Sabha forms panel on proposal to impeach Justice VarmaLok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Tuesday accepted the motion signed by 146 MPs for the impeachment of Justice Yashwant Varma, from whose residence a huge pile of cash was found.

In terror tag for Baloch group, Trump largesse for Pak. Message for India?While the Balochistan Liberation Army has been behind several attacks in Pakistan, particularly targeting its military, what is significant here is the timing of the US announcement.

Don't discard food in open: Top Court circular over stray dogs on premisesA day after the controversial order on Delhi's stray dogs, the Supreme Court has issued a circular directing that all leftover food should be discarded in covered bins to over strays on premises.

Coolie cast fee: What Rajinikanth, Aamir Khan and Lokesh Kanagaraj earnedAs advance bookings for 'Coolie' soar worldwide, here's a peek at what the members of the film, including director Lokesh Kanagaraj and Superstar Rajinikanth, earned for their contribution to the film.

China plans railway line to India's doorsteps, sparks twin concernChina is set to build a massive railway line linking Tibet and northwestern Xinjiang, which reports say will pass near the LAC with India. Beijing's rail push, right through India's Aksai Chin, is expected to add to New Delhi's concerns. Beijing is planning a rail network up to the Nepal border, and the sensitive Chumbi Valley, the area of the 2017 Doklam stand-off.

Delhi-NCR stares at house help crisis amid exodus of Bengali migrantsThe corporate and IT hubs of Noida and Gurgaon, which house a large working-class population, run on migrant labour. A crackdown against illegal Bangladeshi immigrants and fears of a Bihar-like special intensive revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal has led to a sudden exodus of Bengali migrants. Even as a humanitarian crisis unfolds, Delhi-NCR is staring at a domestic help crisis.

Woman alleges 9 fake votes registered on address in BJP's lone Kerala seatA woman in Kerala's Thrissur alleged that nine fake votes were added using her address without her knowledge. CPM claims vacant flats in Poonkunnam were misused for voter list manipulation. Opposition leaders demand a probe into alleged BJP-linked irregularities.

RBI's job gets tougher, thanks to 50% US tariffsRBI kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% and warned that US tariffs and global supply issues could quickly change the outlook.

Shubman Gill pips Stokes to win historic 4th ICC Player of the Month awardIndia's Test captain Shubman Gill has been named ICC Player of the Month for July 2025 after his prolific run in the recent Test series against England.

MBA in K-Pop land: South Korea's rising appeal for Indian studentsSouth Korea is becoming a preferred MBA destination for Indian students seeking quality education and career growth. The country's blend of affordable tuition, scholarships, and corporate ties offers a strategic advantage in Asia's dynamic markets.

A Gen-Z review of Sholay: 50 years later, still a total vibeRevisiting Bollywood classic Sholay through a Gen-Z lens: Basanti's feminist flair, Jai-Veeru's ultimate friendship goals, Gabbar's meme-worthy villainy, and Thakur's poetic revenge.

What is Talaq-e-Hasan that is being challenged in Supreme Court?Eight years after the ban on instant triple talaq or Talaq-e-Biddat, the Supreme Court is examining Talaq-e-Hasan on a plea by a Muslim woman. The apex court has sought views from rights bodies before deciding on its constitutionality. This is more about Talaq-e-Hasan, which allows Muslim men to divorce.

Does Supreme Court order go against Animal Birth Control rules? What it saysThe Supreme Court's order, as well as its criticism of the ABC Rules, which lay out norms for sterilisation of stray dogs, has received pushback from animal welfare activists and NGOs.

Where have Gurugram's gurgling river, green hills gone?Gurugram's rise as a corporate powerhouse has come at the expense of its rivers, wetlands, and the Aravallis that once sustained it. The Sahibi River, the Aravallis, and their forests are now either gone or in a dire state. The city's recurring floods, choking dust, and vanishing green cover are the direct fallout of decades of unchecked, ill-planned "development", which, in effect, have been the reasons for their disappearance.

Idle days, wild rumours: Kohli and Rohit deserve to decide ODI futuresFor all the noise about grey beards and holiday photos, the scoreboard still tells the truest story: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma remain match-winners in one-day cricket. The off-season may fuel idle speculation, but the final call on their ODI futures should rest with the men who've carried Indian cricket on their shoulders.

Korean food craze is not over yet. And it's not just a metro city crushEmerging markets such as Surat, Thiruvananthapuram, Vadodara, Mysuru, and Mangaluru have seen a 59 per cent jump in Korean food orders over the past year.

Big conspiracy: Ex-Karnataka Minister KN Rajanna says he was 'dropped' by CongressFormer Karnataka minister KN Rajanna said the Congress high command was behind his removal. He hinted at a conspiracy but promised details later. His ouster followed remarks on voter list lapses during Congress rule.

Brevis hits 41-ball hundred, youngest to milestone in T20Is for South AfricaAUS vs SA, 2nd T20I: Dewald Brevis scored a blistering 41-ball hundred against Australia in a T20I in Darwin on August 12. He became the youngest man from South Africa to hit a century in the shortest format of the game.

sports.headline: Isak should sack his agent: Former Liverpool manager amidst transfer sagaAlexander Isak's Newcastle exit saga heats up as Don Hutchison blasts the striker's agent, urges a transfer request, and Liverpool waits in the wings after a 110 million pounds bid rejection, keeping fans glued to the summer drama.

Delhi Capitals star replaces Sadia Iqbal as No.1 bowler in T20I rankingsAustralian all-rounder Annabel Sutherland became the No.1 ranked bowler in Women's T20Is, replacing Pakistan left-arm spinner Sadia Iqbal. Iqbal dropped two places in the rankings.

Shubman Gill pips Stokes to win historic 4th ICC Player of the Month awardIndia's Test captain Shubman Gill has been named ICC Player of the Month for July 2025 after his prolific run in the recent Test series against England.

CSK's biggest masterstroke: AB de Villiers applauds Brevis's 41-ball hundredLegendary South African batsman AB de Villiers praised Dewald Brevis's blistering 41-ball century in the second T20 International against Australia at Marrara Cricket Ground, Darwin.

Brevis hits 41-ball hundred, youngest to milestone in T20Is for South AfricaAUS vs SA, 2nd T20I: Dewald Brevis scored a blistering 41-ball hundred against Australia in a T20I in Darwin on August 12. He became the youngest man from South Africa to hit a century in the shortest format of the game.

Secret behind Siraj's strong legs is nalli gosht biryani and paya: AzharuddinFormer Indian captain Mohammad Azharuddin believes that Mohammed Siraj's favourite food is one of the reasons behind his success in red-ball cricket. Azharuddin applauded Siraj's performance at the Oval and backed him to be the next superstar of Indian sport.

Abhimanyu Easwaran at No.3 for India? Ganguly backs Bengal batter for Test roleFormer Indian skipper Sourav Ganguly believes that Abhimanyu Easwaran could bat at No.3 in the Indian Test team. The current position saw shuffling between Sai Sudarshan and Karun Nair during England's five-match series.

DPL 2025: Harshit Rana punished for aggressive send-off against West Delhi LionsNorth Delhi Strikers captain Harshit Rana has been punished for giving an aggressive send-off to Ayush Doseja during Match 19 of the Delhi Premier League 2025 (DPL 2025).

Karnataka bars Women's World Cup matches at Bengaluru stadium over safety fearsBengaluru's M Chinnaswamy Stadium has been dropped from the Women's World Cup 2025 schedule after the Karnataka government refused permission citing safety risks. KSCA expressed disappointment, noting the June 4 stampede happened during a privately organised celebration, not a cricket match.

Jasprit Bumrah slammed by Azharuddin over workload claims: Can't pick and chooseFormer India captain Mohammed Azharuddin slammed Jasprit Bumrah for picking and choosing matches in the name of workload management. Bumrah played just three matches during the England tour.

Abhimanyu Easwaran at No.3 for India? Ganguly backs Bengal batter for Test roleFormer Indian skipper Sourav Ganguly believes that Abhimanyu Easwaran could bat at No.3 in the Indian Test team. The current position saw shuffling between Sai Sudarshan and Karun Nair during England's five-match series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
